benchmark_details.name: Fine-tuning Language Models for Recipe Generation: A Comparative Analysis and Benchmark Study
benchmark_details.overview: This research presents an exploration and study of the recipe generation task by fine-tuning various very small language models, focusing on developing robust evaluation metrics and comparing across different language models for recipe generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To address challenges in recipe generation and allergen substitution through controlled fine-tuning and comprehensive evaluation metrics.

data.source: Food.com dataset containing over 180,000 recipes and 700,000 recipe reviews.
data.annotation: Standardization of ingredient formats and measurements

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on traditional and domain-specific evaluation methods.
methodology.interpretation: Scores range from 0 to 1; higher scores indicate better quality in generated recipes.
methodology.baseline_results: SmolLM and Phi-2 models were evaluated with traditional NLP metrics.
methodology.validation: Evaluation performed on 500 generated recipes from the test set.
